```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(plotly)

```

## R Markdown
data set : https://www.kaggle.com/lepchenkov/usedcarscatalog

```{r cars}
#load data
car_data <- read.csv("cars.csv", encoding = "UTF-8", stringsAsFactors = T)
#attach(car_data)
```

## Including Plots
```{r dis, echo=FALSE}

p1 <- ggplot(car_data, aes(x = year_produced)) + geom_bar() + stat_density()
ggplotly(p1)

p2 <- ggplot(car_data, aes(x = price_usd)) + geom_histogram()
ggplotly(p2)

p3 <- ggplot(car_data, aes(x = odometer_value)) + geom_histogram()
ggplotly(p3)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
